Class Application

  • java.lang.Object
    • Application
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Application
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Author:
    Simon Valcarcel, Blanca Martin This class is the main class, which makes reference to the application
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Returns:

      • createExercise

        public Exercise createExercise(boolean visibility,
                               java.time.LocalDate dateOfBegining,
                               java.time.LocalDate dateOfEnd,
                               double weight)
        This method creates an exercise if the current user is the teacher
        Parameters:
        visibility - - boolean that sets if the exercise is visible or not
        dateOfBegining - - LocalDate referring to the beginning of the exercise
        dateOfEnd - - LocalDate referring to the end of the exercise
        weight - - double which marks the weight of the exercise in a course
        Returns:
        the Exercise created, null if the current user is not the teacher

      • createSingleAnswer

        public Question createSingleAnswer(java.lang.String question,
                                   double weight,
                                   double penalty,
                                   java.lang.String answer,
                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> options)
        This method creates a single answer question if the current user is the teacher
        Parameters:
        question - - String with the wording
        weight - - double with the weight of the question in an exercise
        penalty - - double with the points to be subtracted if the question isn't answered correctly
        answer - - String containing the correct answer
        options - - List of String containing the options of the question
        Returns:
        the Question created, null if the current user is not the teacher

        e - - Exercise answered
